Package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.authentication

Class BaseLoginClient

java.lang.Object
io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.authentication.BaseLoginClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
LoginClient
public abstract class BaseLoginClient extends Object implements LoginClient
Abstract base class for implementing UI-based authentication clients.

This class provides a mechanism for logging in through a UI service, caching session data, and restoring sessions using stored cookies and local storage data. Subclasses must implement the loginImpl(UiServiceFluent, String, String) method to define specific login logic.

The authentication flow consists of:

  • Performing login through UI interaction.
  • Waiting for a successful login indication.
  • Caching session cookies and local storage data for reuse.
  • Restoring an existing session if caching is enabled.

    • login

      public void login(SuperUiServiceFluent<?> uiService, String username, String password, boolean cache)
      Logs in the user and optionally caches session data for reuse.
      Specified by:
      login in interface LoginClient
      Parameters:
      uiService - The UI service used for login interactions.
      username - The username of the user.
      password - The password of the user.
      cache - Whether to cache the session for future reuse.

    • getAuthentication

      public Optional<SessionInfo> getAuthentication(LoginKey loginKey)
      Retrieves cached authentication session info if available.
      Parameters:
      loginKey - The key representing the login credentials.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the session information if found.

    • loginImpl

      protected abstract <T extends UiServiceFluent<?>> void loginImpl(T uiService, String username, String password)
      Performs the actual login operation.

      This method should be implemented by subclasses to define the specific UI interactions required to log in.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of UI service being used.
      Parameters:
      uiService - The UI service for interacting with the login page.
      username - The username for authentication.
      password - The password for authentication.

    • successfulLoginElementLocator

      protected abstract org.openqa.selenium.By successfulLoginElementLocator()
      Provides the locator for an element that indicates a successful login.

      This method should return a By locator that identifies an element that only appears after a successful login, such as a dashboard or a user profile menu.

      Returns:
      A Selenium By locator for the post-login verification element.
